title: c-ya-laterrrr
creator: Dan Hett
one_sentence_description: A hypertext game based on a real experience of the Manchester Arena attack, exploring grief, choice, and what-ifs through branching paths that converge, with warnings for distressing content.

title: The Infinite Woman
creator: Katie Schaag
license: Copyright Katie Schaag – All Rights Reserved
one_sentence_description: An interactive feminist web app that algorithmically remixes Marshall and Beauvoir into infinite scrolling text, visual erasure, and a canvas where users create their own erasure poems.

title: Please, don’t touch me!
creator: René Bauer, Beat Suter
license: © 2019 René Bauer, Beat Suter – All Rights Reserved
one_sentence_description: An artgame about absolute player control, where harassing an AI avatar exposes bullying in games and social media, escalating emotional unrest until the system collapses into submission.

title: MEMORIAS
creator: Jessica Arianne Rodríguez Cabrera
technology: haskell; tidal cycles; hydra; cinecer0; punctual
one_sentence_description: An audiovisual live-coding project using six esolangs that mix natural and computational language to transform autobiographical texts into evolving sound, voice, and visual performances.

title: LiveSpoken : A CoPo Jam Rendition
creator: Kofi Oduro (Illestpreacha)
one_sentence_description: A live performance where improvised live-coding in Sonic Pi meets hip-hop cypher culture, blending real-time coding, songwriting, and freestyle vocals beyond the screen.

title: The Gathering Cloud
creator: J. R. Carpenter
license: © J. R. Carpenter – All Rights Reserved
one_sentence_description: A hypertext poetry project using animated cloud imagery and environmental texts to expose the material and ecological costs hidden behind the metaphor of digital “cloud” storage.

title: forgotten nights
creator: Peter Hebden
one_sentence_description: A recombinatory audio poem where adding or removing stars from an interactive night sky alters the spoken text, exploring memory through oral performance and digital interactivity.

title: SONAR
creator: Daniela Côrtes Maduro, Sérgio Rebelo, João Couceiro e Castro, Pedro Martins
one_sentence_description: A web-based interactive artwork using generative audiovisuals to explore testimonies of Portugal’s Carnation Revolution, mapping history through sound, text, and visual markers.

title: a kiss
creator: Dan Waber
license: Copyright © 2013 Dan Waber – All Rights Reserved
one_sentence_description: A novel-length hypertext love story, celebrated as Twine’s largest project, widely studied in digital literature courses.

title: my Dear coUntess: a letter to lord kelvin
creator: Danny Snelson
one_sentence_description: A streaming web poem that recomposes Alfred Jarry word by word from linked video texts, embracing constraint, failure, and play to explore connection within impossible systems.

title: A Modern Ghost
creator: Artemio Morales
technology: unity; c#; adobe illustrator; adobe indesign; adobe photoshop
one_sentence_description: A digital short story using a 3D touch-controlled canvas to explore environment and navigation, breaking page-based norms while offering an interactive, aesthetically engaging experience.

title: peaceful dream
creator: Ottar Ormstad
one_sentence_description: A Chinese-language adaptation of a book using scattered Norwegian words, images, video, and music to create a poetic, nature-inspired, and meditative “peaceful dream” experience.

title: Blackout Poetry Tool
creator: Jazer Chand
one_sentence_description: A blackout poetry tool exploring human-computer dichotomies, letting users create poems alongside an AI by navigating intuition vs. logic, emotion vs. mechanics, and other binary contrasts.

title: The Offline Website Project
creator: Alex Saum
license: Copyright © Alex Saum – All Rights Reserved
one_sentence_description: A series of locally hosted websites accessible only at the artist’s home, creating non-replicable, site-specific digital works documented via video for limited public experience.

title: Not_A_Number
creator: Xavier Leton
technology: HTML; css; adobe premiere; adobe after effects; google maps itinerary maker
one_sentence_description: Shared, non-commercial works by Xavier Leton, presented online, in performances, and installations, emphasizing public engagement and the creative experience over profit.

title: Please Answer Carefully
creator: litrouke
language: English; Italian; Spanish; Polish; Turkish; Swedish; Indonesian; Korean; Arabic; Portuguese; Russian; German; French; Japanese; Hungarian; Romanian; Dutch; Greek; Simplified Chinese
one_sentence_description: This game explores the horror of the mundane - specifically, the act of taking another mind-numbing survey online - and draws on fears of stalking, control, and surveillance.

title: Remixing Shakespeare: A Netprov in Three Acts
creator: Joellyn Rock
one_sentence_description: A participatory netprov remixing Shakespearean character conflicts with contemporary power dynamics, letting remote writers add text that interacts with looping experimental videos in three acts.

title: The Buoy
creator: Meredith Morran
one_sentence_description: A poetic auto-fiction presented as a diagram-driven PowerPoint, using concrete poetry and theory to explore queer identity, communication, and navigating social and political barriers.

title: How to Rob a Bank
creator: alan bigelow
one_sentence_description: A digital narrative following a novice bank robber and his accomplice, unfolding through their phone searches, texts, apps, and games.

title: Writers Are Not Strangers
creator: Lynda Clark
one_sentence_description: An interactive novella exploring reader-writer dynamics, blending multiple beginnings and endings with randomized, adaptive gameplay that balances player and character agency.
